messages.subject: idea siphons
messages.msgSnippet: Holly and I are planning to go to a movie tomorrow and were reading listings. She and I disagreed about what an R rating really meant, so I found the first
messages.messageBody:
Holly and I are planning to go to a movie tomorrow and were reading listings.
She and I disagreed about what an R rating really meant, so I found the
first google hit with explanations and...

This was in the article, after some discussion of "Who's Afraid of Virginia
Woolf" and them deleting the word "screw" (before movie ratings existed, in the
60's).

-=- The second issue surfaced only a few months later.

This time it was Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, and the Michelangelo Antonioni film
"Blow-Up."-=-

-----------------

I had never heard of "Blow Up" until this afternoon, and rented and watched
half of it before deciding it was probably too scary to watch with Keith and
Kirby out of town and Marty out of the house for a few hours.

It's like a siphon pump, I think, sometimes. When a lot of ideas and
thought and connections are flowing, there seem to be a steady stream of them.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
